title: How to Check Xbox Live Service Status on Android

steps.headline: Go to https://support.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-live-status in a mobile browser.
steps.description: Using your preferred mobile browser, such as Chrome, navigate to the Xbox Live status page. This website will tell you if the service is normal, limited, or unavailable for various services.

steps.headline: Check the status of Xbox Live services.
steps.description:
If a service shows a green checkmark next to it, there are no detected problems and things should be working normally. If you see a red exclamation mark, it means the service is "Limited" and these features or services may not work. Check the status of the following services:

Purchase and Content Usage: affects your ability to buy items, redeem codes, and download purchased items. Xbox Live Core Services: deals with signing in, creating and managing accounts, as well as the "search" feature". TV, Music and Video: concerns Live TV, Groove Music, Movies & TV store, as well as streaming services. Social and Gaming: game matchmaking, cloud storage, leadership boards, Game DVR, avatar editing, and pictures. Games: this section lists any issues with specific games. Apps: this section lists any issues with specific applications.

steps.description: Tap the down arrow next to any service that's showing problems to learn more. This will expand the details and you can find out more information. Check which platforms are affected to see if you might be experiencing the same issues. Microsoft will usually post updates here on the progress of any ongoing issues.

steps.headline: Tap Notify me.
steps.description: It's a green button that will appear when certain services are experiencing problems. This will notify you via your Microsoft account when these services are restored and the problem is resolved. That way you don't have to keep checking and you will be the first to know when Xbox live is working again.

steps.headline: Sign in to your Microsoft account.
steps.description: You'll be prompted to sign into your Microsoft account if you aren't signed in already on your phone's mobile browser. Enter the email address, phone number, or Skype name for your Microsoft account and then press Next. Then enter your password and tap Sign in. This will take you back to the service status page. Tap the checkbox for "Keep me signed in" if you want to stay signed in on your mobile browser.

steps.headline: Enter your phone number.
steps.description: Tap the box under "Phone number" and the mobile number you want to be notified when the service is restored.

steps.headline: Tap Text me or Call me.
steps.description: Select 'Text me' if the numbered you entered can received text messages, or for landline numbers, you can tap 'Call me' to receive an automated call when Xbox services are restored. Standard messaging and call rates will apply as deemed by your phone provider.
